alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Chaves County Plains; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Estancia Valley; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Northeast Highlands; Quay County; Roosevelt County; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Highlands; Southwest Chaves County; Union County; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 22 at 3:06AM MST until February 23 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 50 mph with gusts of 60 to 75 mph expected. Winds may gust as high as 85 mph over the high plains of eastern NM. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, north central, northeast, and southeast New Mexico. * WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 2 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Damage may occur to mobile homes, roofs, sheds, barns, outbuildings, and fences. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be very difficult, especially for high profile vehicles and cargo trains. Blowing dust may reduce visibility below 1/2 mile at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of snow late Wednesday morning into early Wednesday afternoon may produce a period of low visibility with slick travel in the higher terrain of central NM.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.
